    • addDiscount

      public void addDiscount​(ResourceType discount) throws javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException
      Add a new type of resource to the list of resources which get a discount of 1 quantity.
      Parameters:
      discount - is the new type of resource which can be discounted
      Throws:
      javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException - if add more 2 card

    • applyDiscountAbility

      public Resource[] applyDiscountAbility​(Resource[] resources)
      Apply a discount of the types found in the list to the array of resources passed as a parameter in the form of 1 quantity.
      Parameters:
      resources - is the array of resources to which the discount will be applied
      Returns:
      the array after the discounts are applied

    • addProductionAbility

      public void addProductionAbility​(ResourceType resourceIn) throws javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException
      Add a new production ability to the list of productions that can be called.
      Parameters:
      resourceIn - is the input resource of the new production ability
      Throws:
      javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException - if add more 2 card

    • getProductionAbilityResourceIn

      public Resource getProductionAbilityResourceIn() throws UndefinedLeaderCardAbilityException
      Get the resource input of a usable element of the productionAbility list and make that element unusable. An element is usable when the usable attribute of that element is true.
      Returns:
      null if there are two usable elements in the productionAbility list. If there is only one usable element in the productionAbility list, the method return the resource input of that production element
      Throws:
      UndefinedLeaderCardAbilityException

    • getProductionAbilityResourceIn

      public Resource getProductionAbilityResourceIn​(int index) throws EmptyProductionListException
      Get the resource input of the element at the specified index of the productionAbility list and make that element unusable. If the element at the defined index is unusable, the method will behave as if the list is empty, thus throwing the EmptyProductionListException. An element is usable when the usable attribute of that element is true. The method is implemented so that the two possible indexes are 0 and 1.
      Returns:
      the resource input of the production element at the specified index
      Throws:
      EmptyProductionListException - when the productionAbility list is empty

    • resetElementsUsability

      public void resetElementsUsability()
      Sets all elements usable attribute to true.

    • productionAbilityLeft

      public boolean productionAbilityLeft()
      Verify if there is any production which has not yet been activated.
      Returns:
      true is at least a production is left, false if all productions have been activated.

    • addBlankResource

      public void addBlankResource​(ResourceType blankResource) throws javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException
      Add a new resource type to the list of resources in which the blank resource can turn into.
      Parameters:
      blankResource - is the new type of resource to be added to the list
      Throws:
      javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException - if add more 2 card

    • convertBlankResource

      public Resource[] convertBlankResource​(Resource[] resources) throws UndefinedLeaderCardAbilityException
      Convert the blank resources in the passed array into the resource indicated in the blankResourceAbility list, if the list only has one element. If there are no element in the list, all the blank resources in the passed array get removed. If there are two element in the list, the method throws the UndefinedBlankResourceException.
      Parameters:
      resources - is the array that contains the blank resources to be converted
      Returns:
      the array with the converted blank resources if there is one element in the blankResourceAbility list. Returns the array after having removed the blank resources if the list is empty
      Throws:
      UndefinedLeaderCardAbilityException - if there are two element in the blankResourceAbility list

    • getBlankResourcesType

      public ResourceType[] getBlankResourcesType()
      Get the resource type of the one or two resources contained in the blankResourceAbility list.
      Returns:
      an array with the element(s) in the blankResourceAbility list. If there are no elements, returns null

    • addDepot

      public void addDepot​(ResourceType depotResource) throws javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException
      Add a new depot to the depotAbility list.
      Parameters:
      depotResource - is the resource type of the new depot
      Throws:
      javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException - if add more 2 card

    • addResources

      public void addResources​(Resource[] resources) throws IllegalInputException
      Description copied from interface: Store
      add the resources contained into the param to the target depot
      Specified by:
      addResources in interface Store
      Parameters:
      resources - contains the resources to be added
      Throws:
      IllegalInputException - if client input isn't correct

    • giveResources

      public Resource[] giveResources​(Resource[] resources, boolean remove)
      Description copied from interface: Store
      determines if the depot contains the resources in the param, if it does and remove is true, those resources get removed from the depot; if it does and remove is false, those resources are only peeked. If the resources aren't in the store, returns the remaining resources from the input. If all resources are present in the store, returns null.
      Specified by:
      giveResources in interface Store
      Parameters:
      resources - contains the resources to be removed
      remove - if true remove the resources passed in the array, if false doesn't change the store
      Returns:
      a Resource or a Resource array that contains the required resources which aren't in the store

    • peekAllResources

      public Resource[] peekAllResources()
      Description copied from interface: Store
      returns all the resources contained in the depot
      Specified by:
      peekAllResources in interface Store
      Returns:
      a Resource or a Resource array with type and quantity of each resource

    • peekAllResources

      public Resource peekAllResources​(int index)
      peek resource specify in index
      Parameters:
      index - of depot list
      Returns:
      resource at index in depot list

    • giveResources

      public Resource giveResources​(Resource resource, boolean remove, int index)
      Determines if the depot at the defined index in the depotAbility list contains the resources in the param, if it does and remove is true, those resources get removed from the depot; if it does and remove is false, those resources are only peeked. If the resources aren't in the store, returns the remaining resources from the input. If all resources are present in the store, returns null.
      Parameters:
      resource - contains the resources to be removed
      remove - if true remove the resources passed in the array, if false doesn't change the store
      index - of the depotAbility list at which the target depot is located
      Returns:
      an array that contains the required resources which aren't in the store

    • numLeaderDepot

      public int numLeaderDepot()
      Get the number of leader with depot ability
      Returns:
      the number of leader with depot ability activated

    • resetAbilities

      public void resetAbilities()
      reset all ability
